page.title: 10Pearsie House,Cortachy
page.content: Approximately 3km east of Cortachy is Pearsie House,built at the turn of the century and owned for the past 8 years by the Earl of Inchcape,whose business interests are in the P and O Shipping Line of which he was chairman.Prior to this it was the property of Lord Granville. The estate covers 4000 acres and includes 4 farms which are controlled by a farm manager.Also employed,are a forester,gamekeeper,2 shepherd/cattle- men and one tractor man.Pearsie House and grounds are looked after by a married couple whose duties are care_ taking and gardening. Pearsie House and Downiepark House in Cortachy Estate were built by brothers and are almost identical.
